subject: iptables: add libxt_cgroup frontend
commitMessage:
iptables: add libxt_cgroup frontend

This patch adds the user space extension/frontend for process matching
based on cgroups from the kernel patch entitled "netfilter: xtables:
lightweight process control group matching".

Signed-off-by: Daniel Borkmann <dborkman@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Pablo Neira Ayuso <pablo@netfilter.org>
[backport from upstream commit 6465867eb48506687872b838b1ddfee61d1a0aeb]
[it is needed for resourced]
Signed-off-by: Przemyslaw Kedzierski <p.kedzierski@samsung.com>
Change-Id: Ic3ef69176529038d39ee89e08026f8272287c703

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

What is the expected use of this module in Tizen?

Patch Set 1:

This module is needed for identification of application sending or receivig network packets.
It is needed for collectiong of statistics of network traffic for every application.

Patch Set 1:

How do you identify applications with cgroups? How these cgroups are going to be assigned to apps? AFAIK the chosen way to identify apps on the platform is Smack label, not cgroup.

This seems to be an important change to the concept of launching and identifying applications. Please share and discuss details of your solution first.
